intro: Sopubia delphiniifolia, commonly known as the waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Sopubia delphiniifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils near water sources such as rivers and streams.
